revised_title: Evolutionary Systematics and Classification of Bivalve Molluscs
tldr: This article discusses the evolutionary systematics and classification of bivalve molluscs, highlighting the importance of studying both modern and fossil specimens. The author emphasizes the need for a comprehensive understanding of these animals, despite their external similarities, as they display a remarkable degree of adaptive radiation and convergence. The publication of papers from a related discussion meeting aims to bring different views into close association and contribute to the wider understanding of this class of animals.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
